attributes.action: ensure that lesson plans and resources for eating disorder awareness are introduced into the PSHE curriculum for all secondary school students.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
beat, the UK’s leading eating disorder charity, carried out a survey with young people affected by eating disorders. The results demonstrated that 86% of sufferers developed their eating disorder between the ages of 11 and 16 years old, secondary school age.
 
Overwhelmingly these respondents felt that their schools did not offer the correct awareness, support or understanding of this mental illness to them, their peers, or their families. 

Increasing awareness of eating disorders within secondary schools will ultimately lead to improved understanding, empathy and prevention of eating disorders. Additionally, providing access to support will mean young people can seek help early which greatly increases the chances of recovery from an eating disorder.
